snippet: Although initial reactions to the Supreme Court’s ruling that Medicaid expansion was up to individual states was along party lines, subsequent responses are more nuanced.
abstract: Initial reactions by governors to the Supreme Court’s ruling that Medicaid expansion is up to individual states are split along party lines, but subsequent responses are more nuanced; most governors in both parties at the National Governors Association meeting say they are unsure and need to study how to proceed with their Medicaid programs.
lead_paragraph: Although initial reactions to the Supreme Court’s ruling that Medicaid expansion was up to individual states was along party lines, subsequent responses are more nuanced.

headline.seo: Governors Face Hard Choices Over Medicaid Expansion
headline.main: Many Governors Are Still Unsure About Medicaid Expansion
headline.print_headline: Many Governors Are Still Unsure About Medicaid Expansion

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
